snippet: The lives of two old men from opposing sides in World War II offer invaluable moral lessons.
abstract: Editorial remarks on contrasting lives of Nicholas Winton, recently deceased English pacifist who helped 669 children evade Nazis in Czechoslovakia, and Oskar Groning, former SS soldier on trial for war crimes related to Auschwitz; suggests both men's lives offer invaluable moral lessons from war.
lead_paragraph: The lives of two old men from opposing sides in World War II offer invaluable moral lessons.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
